entry.name: R9980
entry.text: R9980 An ENVELOPE MUST conform to the structure specified in SOAP 1.1 Section 4, 'SOAP Envelope'.

entry.name: R9981
entry.text: R9981 An ENVELOPE MUST have exactly zero or one child elements of the soap:Body element.

entry.name: R1015
entry.text: R1015 A RECEIVER MUST generate a fault if they encounter an envelope whose document element is not soap:Envelope.

entry.name: R1014
entry.text: R1014 The children of the soap:Body element in an ENVELOPE MUST be namespace qualified.

entry.name: R1008
entry.text: R1008 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT contain a Document Type Declaration.

entry.name: R1009
entry.text: R1009 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT contain Processing Instructions.

entry.name: R1033
entry.text: R1033 An ENVELOPE SHOULD NOT contain the namespace declaration xmlns:xml='http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace'.

entry.name: R1034
entry.text: R1034 A DESCRIPTION SHOULD NOT contain the namespace declaration xmlns:xml='http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace'.

entry.name: R1011
entry.text: R1011 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT have any element children of soap:Envelope following the soap:Body element.

entry.name: R1005
entry.text: R1005 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT contain soap:encodingStyle attributes on any of the elements whose namespace name is 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'.

entry.name: R1006
entry.text: R1006 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT contain soap:encodingStyle attributes on any element that is a child of soap:Body.

entry.name: R1007
entry.text: R1007 An ENVELOPE described in an rpc-literal binding MUST NOT contain soap:encodingStyle attribute on any element that is a grandchild of soap:Body.

entry.name: R1013
entry.text: R1013 An ENVELOPE containing a soap:mustUnderstand attribute MUST only use the lexical forms '0' and '1'.

entry.name: R1017
entry.text: R1017 A RECEIVER MUST NOT mandate the use of the xsi:type attribute in envelopes except as required in order to indicate a derived type (see XML Schema Part 1: Structures, Section 2.6.1).

entry.name: R1032
entry.text: R1032 The soap:Envelope, soap:Header, and soap:Body elements in an ENVELOPE MUST NOT have attributes in the namespace 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'.

entry.name: R1025
entry.text: R1025 A RECEIVER MUST handle envelopes in such a way that it appears that all checking of mandatory header blocks is performed before any actual processing.

entry.name: R1027
entry.text: R1027 A RECEIVER MUST generate a 'soap:MustUnderstand' fault when an envelope contains a mandatory header block (i.e., one that has a soap:mustUnderstand attribute with the value '1') targeted at the receiver (via soap:actor ) that the receiver does not understand.

entry.name: R1028
entry.text: R1028 When a fault is generated by a RECEIVER, further processing SHOULD NOT be performed on the SOAP envelope aside from that which is necessary to rollback, or compensate for, any effects of processing the envelope prior to the generation of the fault.

entry.name: R1029
entry.text: R1029 Where the normal outcome of processing a SOAP envelope would have resulted in the transmission of a SOAP response, but rather a fault is generated instead, a RECEIVER MUST transmit a fault in place of the response.

entry.name: R1030
entry.text: R1030 A RECEIVER that generates a fault SHOULD notify the end user that a fault has been generated when practical, by whatever means is deemed appropriate to the circumstance.

entry.name: R1107
entry.text: R1107 A RECEIVER MUST interpret a SOAP message as a Fault when the soap:Body of the message has a single soap:Fault child.

entry.name: R1000
entry.text: R1000 When an ENVELOPE is a Fault, the soap:Fault element MUST NOT have element children other than faultcode, faultstring, faultactor and detail.

entry.name: R1001
entry.text: R1001 When an ENVELOPE is a Fault, the element children of the soap:Fault element MUST be unqualified.

entry.name: R1002
entry.text: R1002 A RECEIVER MUST accept faults that have any number of elements, including zero, appearing as children of the detail element. Such children can be qualified or unqualified.

entry.name: R1003
entry.text: R1003 A RECEIVER MUST accept faults that have any number of qualified or unqualified attributes, including zero, appearing on the detail element. The namespace of qualified attributes can be anything other than 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'.

entry.name: R1016
entry.text: R1016 A RECEIVER MUST accept faults that carry an xml:lang attribute on the faultstring element.

entry.name: R1004
entry.text: R1004 When an ENVELOPE contains a faultcode element, the content of that element SHOULD be either one of the fault codes defined in SOAP 1.1 (supplying additional information if necessary in the detail element), or a Qname whose namespace is controlled by the fault's specifying authority (in that order of preference).

entry.name: R1031
entry.text: R1031 When an ENVELOPE contains a faultcode element the content of that element SHOULD NOT use of the SOAP 1.1 'dot' notation to refine the meaning of the fault.

entry.name: R1141
entry.text: R1141 A MESSAGE MUST be sent using either HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/1.0.

entry.name: R1140
entry.text: R1140 A MESSAGE SHOULD be sent using HTTP/1.1.

entry.name: R1132
entry.text: R1132 A HTTP request MESSAGE MUST use the HTTP POST method.

entry.name: R1108
entry.text: R1108 A MESSAGE MUST NOT use the HTTP Extension Framework (RFC2774).

entry.name: R1109
entry.text: R1109 The value of the SOAPAction HTTP header field in a HTTP request MESSAGE MUST be a quoted string.

entry.name: R1119
entry.text: R1119 A RECEIVER MAY respond with a fault if the value of the SOAPAction HTTP header field in a message is not quoted.

entry.name: R1127
entry.text: R1127 A RECEIVER MUST NOT rely on the value of the SOAPAction HTTP header to correctly process the message.

entry.name: R1124
entry.text: R1124 An INSTANCE MUST use a 2xx HTTP status code on a response message that indicates the successful outcome of a HTTP request.

entry.name: R1111
entry.text: R1111 An INSTANCE SHOULD use a '200 OK' HTTP status code on a response message that contains an envelope that is not a fault.

entry.name: R1112
entry.text: R1112 An INSTANCE SHOULD use either a '200 OK' or '202 Accepted' HTTP status code for a response message that does not contain a SOAP envelope but indicates the successful outcome of a HTTP request.

entry.name: R1130
entry.text: R1130 An INSTANCE MUST use the '307 Temporary Redirect' HTTP status code when redirecting a request to a different endpoint.

entry.name: R1131
entry.text: R1131 A CONSUMER MAY automatically redirect a request when it encounters a '307 Temporary Redirect' HTTP status code in a response.

entry.name: R1125
entry.text: R1125 An INSTANCE MUST use a 4xx HTTP status code for a response that indicates a problem with the format of a request.

entry.name: R1113
entry.text: R1113 An INSTANCE SHOULD use a '400 Bad Request' HTTP status code, if a HTTP request message is malformed.

entry.name: R1114
entry.text: R1114 An INSTANCE SHOULD use a '405 Method not Allowed' HTTP status code if a HTTP request message's method is not 'POST'.

entry.name: R1115
entry.text: R1115 An INSTANCE SHOULD use a '415 Unsupported Media Type' HTTP status code if a HTTP request message's Content-Type header field-value is not permitted by its WSDL description.

entry.name: R1126
entry.text: R1126 An INSTANCE MUST return a '500 Internal Server Error' HTTP status code if the response envelope is a Fault.

entry.name: R1120
entry.text: R1120 An INSTANCE MAY use the HTTP state mechanism ('Cookies').

entry.name: R1122
entry.text: R1122 An INSTANCE using Cookies SHOULD conform to RFC2965.

entry.name: R1121
entry.text: R1121 An INSTANCE SHOULD NOT require consumer support for Cookies in order to function correctly.

entry.name: R1123
entry.text: R1123 The value of the cookie MUST be considered to be opaque by the CONSUMER.

entry.name: R0001
entry.text: R0001 Either an INSTANCE 's WSDL 1.1 description, its UDDI binding template, or both MUST be available to an authorized consumer upon request.

entry.name: R2028
entry.text: R2028 A DESCRIPTION using the WSDL namespace (prefixed 'wsdl' in this Profile) MUST be valid according to the XML Schema found at ' http://ws-i.org/profiles/basic/1.1/wsdl-2004-08-24.xsd '.

entry.name: R2029
entry.text: R2029 A DESCRIPTION using the WSDL SOAP binding namespace (prefixed 'soapbind' in this Profile) MUST be valid according to the XML Schema found at ' http://ws-i.org/profiles/basic/1.1/wsdlsoap-2004-08-24.xsd '.

entry.name: R2001
entry.text: R2001 A DESCRIPTION MUST only use the WSDL 'import' statement to import another WSDL description.

entry.name: R2803
entry.text: R2803 In a DESCRIPTION, the namespace attribute of the wsdl:import MUST NOT be a relative URI.

entry.name: R2002
entry.text: R2002 To import XML Schema Definitions, a DESCRIPTION MUST use the XML Schema 'import' statement.

entry.name: R2003
entry.text: R2003 A DESCRIPTION MUST use the XML Schema 'import' statement only within the xsd:schema element of the types section.

entry.name: R2004
entry.text: R2004 In a DESCRIPTION the schemaLocation attribute of an xsd:import element MUST NOT resolve to any document whose root element is not 'schema' from the namespace 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema'.

entry.name: R2009
entry.text: R2009 An XML Schema directly or indirectly imported by a DESCRIPTION MAY include the Unicode Byte Order Mark (BOM).

entry.name: R2010
entry.text: R2010 An XML Schema directly or indirectly imported by a DESCRIPTION MUST use either UTF-8 or UTF-16 encoding.

entry.name: R2011
entry.text: R2011 An XML Schema directly or indirectly imported by a DESCRIPTION MUST use version 1.0 of the eXtensible Markup Language W3C Recommendation.

entry.name: R2007
entry.text: R2007 A DESCRIPTION MUST specify a non-empty location attribute on the wsdl:import element.

entry.name: R2008
entry.text: R2008 A CONSUMER MAY, but need not, retrieve a WSDL description from the URI specified in the location attribute on a wsdl:import element.

entry.name: R2022
entry.text: R2022 When they appear in a DESCRIPTION, wsdl:import elements MUST precede all other elements from the WSDL namespace except wsdl:documentation.

entry.name: R2023
entry.text: R2023 When they appear in a DESCRIPTION, wsdl:types elements MUST precede all other elements from the WSDL namespace except wsdl:documentation and wsdl:import.

entry.name: R4004
entry.text: R4004 A DESCRIPTION MUST use version 1.0 of the eXtensible Markup Language W3C Recommendation.

entry.name: R4005
entry.text: R4005 A DESCRIPTION SHOULD NOT contain the namespace declaration xmlns:xml='http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace'.

entry.name: R4002
entry.text: R4002 A DESCRIPTION MAY include the Unicode Byte Order Mark (BOM).

entry.name: R4003
entry.text: R4003 A DESCRIPTION MUST use either UTF-8 or UTF-16 encoding.

entry.name: R2005
entry.text: R2005 The targetNamespace attribute on the wsdl:definitions element of a description that is being imported MUST have same the value as the namespace attribute on the wsdl:import element in the importing DESCRIPTION.

entry.name: R2030
entry.text: R2030 In a DESCRIPTION the wsdl:documentation element MAY be present as the first child element of wsdl:import, wsdl:part and wsdl:definitions in addition to the elements cited in the WSDL1.1 specification.

entry.name: R2025
entry.text: R2025 A DESCRIPTION containing WSDL extensions MUST NOT use them to contradict other requirements of the Profile.

entry.name: R2026
entry.text: R2026 A DESCRIPTION SHOULD NOT include extension elements with a wsdl:required attribute value of 'true' on any WSDL construct ( wsdl:binding, wsdl:portType, wsdl:message, wsdl:types or wsdl:import ) that claims conformance to the Profile.

entry.name: R2027
entry.text: R2027 If during the processing of a description, a consumer encounters a WSDL extension element that has a wsdl:required attribute with a boolean value of 'true' that the consumer does not understand or cannot process, the CONSUMER MUST fail processing.

entry.name: R2101
entry.text: R2101 A DESCRIPTION MUST NOT use QName references to WSDL components in namespaces that have been neither imported, nor defined in the referring WSDL document.

entry.name: R2102
entry.text: R2102 A QName reference to a Schema component in a DESCRIPTION MUST use the namespace defined in the targetNamespace attribute on the xsd:schema element, or to a namespace defined in the namespace attribute on an xsd:import element within the xsd:schema element.

entry.name: R2105
entry.text: R2105 All xsd:schema elements contained in a wsdl:types element of a DESCRIPTION MUST have a targetNamespace attribute with a valid and non-null value, UNLESS the xsd:schema element has xsd:import and/or xsd:annotation as its only child element(s).

entry.name: R2110
entry.text: R2110 In a DESCRIPTION, declarations MUST NOT extend or restrict the soapenc:Array type.

entry.name: R2111
entry.text: R2111 In a DESCRIPTION, declarations MUST NOT use wsdl:arrayType attribute in the type declaration.

entry.name: R2112
entry.text: R2112 In a DESCRIPTION, elements SHOULD NOT be named using the convention ArrayOfXXX.

entry.name: R2113
entry.text: R2113 An ENVELOPE MUST NOT include the soapenc:arrayType attribute.

entry.name: R2114
entry.text: R2114 The target namespace for WSDL definitions and the target namespace for schema definitions in a DESCRIPTION MAY be the same.

entry.name: R2201
entry.text: R2201 A document-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST, in each of its soapbind:body element(s), have at most one part listed in the parts attribute, if the parts attribute is specified.

entry.name: R2209
entry.text: R2209 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION SHOULD bind every wsdl:part of a wsdl:message in the wsdl:portType to which it refers with a binding extension element.

entry.name: R2210
entry.text: R2210 If a document-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION does not specify the parts attribute on a soapbind:body element, the corresponding abstract wsdl:message MUST define zero or one wsdl:parts.

entry.name: R2202
entry.text: R2202 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MAY contain soapbind:body element(s) that specify that zero parts form the soap:Body.

entry.name: R2203
entry.text: R2203 An rpc-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST refer, in its soapbind:body element(s), only to wsdl:part element(s) that have been defined using the type attribute.

entry.name: R2211
entry.text: R2211 An ENVELOPE described with an rpc-literal binding MUST NOT have the xsi:nil attribute with a value of '1' or 'true' on the part accessors.

entry.name: R2207
entry.text: R2207 A wsdl:message in a DESCRIPTION MAY contain wsdl:parts that use the elements attribute provided those wsdl:parts are not referred to by a soapbind:body in an rpc-literal binding.

entry.name: R2204
entry.text: R2204 A document-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST refer, in each of its soapbind:body element(s), only to wsdl:part element(s) that have been defined using the element attribute.

entry.name: R2208
entry.text: R2208 A binding in a DESCRIPTION MAY contain soapbind:header element(s) that refer to wsdl:parts in the same wsdl:message that are referred to by its soapbind:body element(s).

entry.name: R2212
entry.text: R2212 An ENVELOPE MUST contain exactly one part accessor element for each of the wsdl:part elements bound to the envelope's corresponding soapbind:body element.

entry.name: R2213
entry.text: R2213 In a doc-literal description where the value of the parts attribute of soapbind:body is an empty string, the corresponding ENVELOPE MUST have no element content in the soap:Body element.

entry.name: R2214
entry.text: R2214 In a rpc-literal description where the value of the parts attribute of soapbind:body is an empty string, the corresponding ENVELOPE MUST have no part accessor elements.

entry.name: R2205
entry.text: R2205 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST refer, in each of its soapbind:header, soapbind:headerfault and soapbind:fault elements, only to wsdl:part element(s) that have been defined using the element attribute.

entry.name: R2206
entry.text: R2206 A wsdl:message in a DESCRIPTION containing a wsdl:part that uses the element attribute MUST refer, in that attribute, to a global element declaration.

entry.name: R2301
entry.text: R2301 The order of the elements in the soap:Body of an ENVELOPE MUST be the same as that of the wsdl:parts in the wsdl:message that describes it for each of the wsdl:part elements bound to the envelope's corresponding soapbind:body element.

entry.name: R2302
entry.text: R2302 A DESCRIPTION MAY use the parameterOrder attribute of an wsdl:operation element to indicate the return value and method signatures as a hint to code generators.

entry.name: R2303
entry.text: R2303 A DESCRIPTION MUST NOT use Solicit-Response and Notification type operations in a wsdl:portType definition.

entry.name: R2304
entry.text: R2304 A wsdl:portType in a DESCRIPTION MUST have operations with distinct values for their name attributes.

entry.name: R2305
entry.text: R2305 A wsdl:operation element child of a wsdl:portType element in a DESCRIPTION MUST be constructed so that the parameterOrder attribute, if present, omits at most 1 wsdl:part from the output message.

entry.name: R2306
entry.text: R2306 A wsdl:message in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT specify both type and element attributes on the same wsdl:part.

entry.name: R2401
entry.text: R2401 A wsdl:binding element in a DESCRIPTION MUST use WSDL SOAP Binding as defined in WSDL 1.1 Section 3.

entry.name: R2701
entry.text: R2701 The wsdl:binding element in a DESCRIPTION MUST be constructed so that its soapbind:binding child element specifies the transport attribute.

entry.name: R2702
entry.text: R2702 A wsdl:binding element in a DESCRIPTION MUST specify the HTTP transport protocol with SOAP binding. Specifically, the transport attribute of its soapbind:binding child MUST have the value 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http'.

entry.name: R2705
entry.text: R2705 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST either be a rpc-literal binding or a document-literal binding.

entry.name: R2706
entry.text: R2706 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST use the value of 'literal' for the use attribute in all soapbind:body, soapbind:fault, soapbind:header and soapbind:headerfault elements.

entry.name: R2709
entry.text: R2709 A wsdl:portType in a DESCRIPTION MAY have zero or more wsdl:bindings that refer to it, defined in the same or other WSDL documents.

entry.name: R2710
entry.text: R2710 The operations in a wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST result in operation signatures that are different from one another.

entry.name: R2711
entry.text: R2711 A DESCRIPTION SHOULD NOT have more than one wsdl:port with the same value for the location attribute of the soapbind:address element.

entry.name: R2712
entry.text: R2712 A document-literal binding MUST be serialized as an ENVELOPE with a soap:Body whose child element is an instance of the global element declaration referenced by the corresponding wsdl:message part.

entry.name: R2714
entry.text: R2714 For one-way operations, an INSTANCE MUST NOT return a HTTP response that contains an envelope. Specifically, the HTTP response entity-body must be empty.

entry.name: R2750
entry.text: R2750 A CONSUMER MUST ignore an envelope carried in a HTTP response message in a one-way operation.

entry.name: R2727
entry.text: R2727 For one-way operations, a CONSUMER MUST NOT interpret a successful HTTP response status code (i.e., 2xx) to mean the message is valid or that the receiver would process it.

entry.name: R2716
entry.text: R2716 A document-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT have the namespace attribute specified on contained soapbind:body, soapbind:header, soapbind:headerfault and soapbind:fault elements.

entry.name: R2717
entry.text: R2717 An rpc-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST have the namespace attribute specified, the value of which MUST be an absolute URI, on contained soapbind:body elements.

entry.name: R2726
entry.text: R2726 An rpc-literal binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT have the namespace attribute specified on contained soapbind:header, soapbind:headerfault and soapbind:fault elements.

entry.name: R2718
entry.text: R2718 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST have the same set of wsdl:operations as the wsdl:portType to which it refers.

entry.name: R2719
entry.text: R2719 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MAY contain no soapbind:headerfault elements if there are no known header faults.

entry.name: R2740
entry.text: R2740 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION SHOULD contain a soapbind:fault describing each known fault.

entry.name: R2741
entry.text: R2741 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION SHOULD contain a soapbind:headerfault describing each known header fault.

entry.name: R2742
entry.text: R2742 An ENVELOPE MAY contain fault with a detail element that is not described by a soapbind:fault element in the corresponding WSDL description.

entry.name: R2743
entry.text: R2743 An ENVELOPE MAY contain the details of a header processing related fault in a SOAP header block that is not described by a soapbind:headerfault element in the corresponding WSDL description.

entry.name: R2720
entry.text: R2720 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST use the part attribute with a schema type of 'NMTOKEN' on all contained soapbind:header and soapbind:headerfault elements.

entry.name: R2749
entry.text: R2749 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT use the parts attribute on contained soapbind:header and soapbind:headerfault elements.

entry.name: R2721
entry.text: R2721 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MUST have the name attribute specified on all contained soapbind:fault elements.

entry.name: R2754
entry.text: R2754 In a DESCRIPTION, the value of the name attribute on a soapbind:fault element MUST match the value of the name attribute on its parent wsdl:fault element.

entry.name: R2722
entry.text: R2722 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION MAY specify the use attribute on contained soapbind:fault elements.

entry.name: R2723
entry.text: R2723 If in a wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION the use attribute on a contained soapbind:fault element is present, its value MUST be 'literal'.

entry.name: R2707
entry.text: R2707 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION that contains one or more soapbind:body, soapbind:fault, soapbind:header or soapbind:headerfault elements that do not specify the use attribute MUST be interpreted as though the value 'literal' had been specified in each case.

entry.name: R2724
entry.text: R2724 If an INSTANCE receives an envelope that is inconsistent with its WSDL description, it SHOULD generate a soap:Fault with a faultcode of 'Client', unless a 'MustUnderstand' or 'VersionMismatch' fault is generated.

entry.name: R2725
entry.text: R2725 If an INSTANCE receives an envelope that is inconsistent with its WSDL description, it MUST check for 'VersionMismatch', 'MustUnderstand' and 'Client' fault conditions in that order.

entry.name: R2729
entry.text: R2729 An ENVELOPE described with an rpc-literal binding that is a response MUST have a wrapper element whose name is the corresponding wsdl:operation name suffixed with the string 'Response'.

entry.name: R2735
entry.text: R2735 An ENVELOPE described with an rpc-literal binding MUST place the part accessor elements for parameters and return value in no namespace.

entry.name: R2755
entry.text: R2755 The part accessor elements in a MESSAGE described with an rpc-literal binding MUST have a local name of the same value as the name attribute of the corresponding wsdl:part element.

entry.name: R2737
entry.text: R2737 An ENVELOPE described with an rpc-literal binding MUST namespace qualify the descendents of part accessor elements for the parameters and the return value, as defined by the schema in which the part accessor types are defined.

entry.name: R2738
entry.text: R2738 An ENVELOPE MUST include all soapbind:headers specified on a wsdl:input or wsdl:output of a wsdl:operation of a wsdl:binding that describes it.

entry.name: R2739
entry.text: R2739 An ENVELOPE MAY contain SOAP header blocks that are not described in the wsdl:binding that describes it.

entry.name: R2753
entry.text: R2753 An ENVELOPE containing SOAP header blocks that are not described in the appropriate wsdl:binding MAY have the mustUnderstand attribute on such SOAP header blocks set to '1'.

entry.name: R2751
entry.text: R2751 The order of soapbind:header elements in soapbind:binding sections of a DESCRIPTION MUST be considered independent of the order of SOAP header blocks in the envelope.

entry.name: R2752
entry.text: R2752 An ENVELOPE MAY contain more than one instance of each SOAP header block for each soapbind:header element in the appropriate child of soapbind:binding in the corresponding description.

entry.name: R2744
entry.text: R2744 A HTTP request MESSAGE MUST contain a SOAPAction HTTP header field with a quoted value equal to the value of the soapAction attribute of soapbind:operation, if present in the corresponding WSDL description.

entry.name: R2745
entry.text: R2745 A HTTP request MESSAGE MUST contain a SOAPAction HTTP header field with a quoted empty string value, if in the corresponding WSDL description, the soapAction of soapbind:operation is either not present, or present with an empty string as its value.

entry.name: R2747
entry.text: R2747 A CONSUMER MUST understand and process all WSDL 1.1 SOAP Binding extension elements, irrespective of the presence or absence of the wsdl:required attribute on an extension element; and irrespective of the value of the wsdl:required attribute, when present.

entry.name: R2748
entry.text: R2748 A CONSUMER MUST NOT interpret the presence of the wsdl:required attribute on a soapbind extension element with a value of 'false' to mean the extension element is optional in the envelopes generated from the WSDL description.

entry.name: R2800
entry.text: R2800 A DESCRIPTION MAY use any construct from XML Schema 1.0.

entry.name: R2801
entry.text: R2801 A DESCRIPTION MUST use XML Schema 1.0 Recommendation as the basis of user defined datatypes and structures.

entry.name: R0003
entry.text: R0003 A DESCRIPTION's conformance claims MUST be children of the wsdl:documentation element of each of the elements: wsdl:port, wsdl:binding, wsdl:portType, wsdl:operation (as a child element of wsdl:portType but not of wsdl:binding) and wsdl:message.
